block.p: Arianne Adams, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Adams of Emmaus, Pa., was married on Friday to Thomas O'Brien Criqui, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald L. Criqui of Essex Fells, N.J. The Rev. John F. Morley officiated at St. Catharine Roman Catholic Church in Spring Lake, N.J.

The bride and bridegroom work at Merrill Lynch in New York, where she is a vice president who sells stock derivatives to institutional investors and he is a managing director who helps develop, market and set pricing for new corporate bond issues.

Arianne Adams, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Adams of Emmaus, Pa., was married on Friday to Thomas Oâ€™Brien Criqui, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald L. Criqui of Essex Fells, N.J. The Rev. John F. Morley officiated at St. Catharine Roman Catholic Church in Spring Lake, N.J.

Arianne Adams, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Adams of Emmaus, Pa., was married on Friday to Thomas O'Brien Criqui, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald L. Criqui of Essex Fells, N.J. The Rev. John F. Morley officiated at St. Catharine Roman Catholic Church in Spring Lake, N.J.

The bride and bridegroom work at Merrill Lynch in New York, where she is a vice president who sells stock derivatives to institutional investors and he is a managing director who helps develop, market and set pricing for new corporate bond issues.

Mrs. Criqui, 29, graduated from Penn State. Her father is a steel and plastics manufacturers representative in Emmaus, and is also a partner in Westmoreland Plastics, a company in Latrobe, Pa. Her mother, Diane E. Adams, retired last month as a substitute teacher in the East Penn School District in Emmaus.

Mr. Criqui, 40, graduated from Princeton and received an M.B.A. from Harvard. He is also an announcer for Princeton football and basketball games on the Patriot Communications cable television system.
His father is an announcer for National Football League games on CBS, and also announces Notre Dame football games on the Westwood One radio network.
